description.narrative: Enhanced policy and monitoring for child rights realization: By end of 2020, state institutions have strengthened participatory systems to implement and monitor laws, national programmes and strategies including human rights

sector.narrative: CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations
Data, research, M&E, and use of evidence on children with disabilities

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Republic of Turkmenistan Country Programme Action Plan
Republic of Turkmenistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Turkmenisan (Reducing Social Inequities)
Rep. of Turkmenistan Country Programme Document 2016-2020
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced policy and monitoring for child rights realization: By end of 2020, state institutions have strengthened participatory systems to implement and monitor laws, national programmes and strategies including human rights

description.narrative: Turkmenistan completed the fieldwork of the 2019 MICS and made progress towards availability and disaggregation of data on child-related SDG indicators. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2020

title.narrative: Availability of national data disaggregarted by sex, age and geography on child rights realization, including data on children with disabilities.

baseline.value: Initial agreement of the Governmnet to conduct MICS in 2019

target.value: 2020:The final survey findings report (SFR) of the 2019 MICS and snapshots are available by end of May; the compilation of statistical data on people and children with disabilities from all the sources is available by the end of the year

actual.value: 2019:The State Statistics Committee completed the fieldwork of the 2019 Turkmenistan MICS in early August. The survey data has been cleaned, finalised and associated with the weights through the close technical consultative with experts from RO MICS team. The wealth index syntaxes and tabulation plan cus

baseline.value: Last SitAn was conducted in 2013 focusing only on ECD

target.value: 2020:A short and updated version of the SitAn is finalized in Eng and Rus and disseminated; initial steps are taken to get ready for its 2021 update.

actual.value: 2019:The Youth Sitan, an inter-agency undertaking led by UNICEF, was drafted and shared with the Government. Since the feedback was delayed, the report was also finalized later than planned. The findings and implications of the final report were discussed with all the stakeholders at a round-table organi

title.narrative: Availability of baseline assessment for SDG indicators adopted by the Government and the measurement system of which UNICEF committed to support

baseline.value: No baseline assessment. An SDG monitoirng framework was drafted in discussion with the Government, but without reffering to actual values/baselines and discussion about diasaggregation of data

target.value: 2020:Support provided to update the baselines and progress for adopted SDG indicators on the basis of the 2019 MICS data, particularly for child-related 55 indicators

actual.value: 2019:The baseline assessment for selected SDG indicators developed by UNICEF in 2018 served as a reference for the VNR and other SDG-related reports and discussions. UNICEF Turkmenistan developed insights on data availability and disaggregation focusing on the theme of the 2019 VNR. In addition, UNICEF C

title.narrative: Development of timely and quality state party report on the CRC and optional protocols

baseline.value: There is an Interministerial Commission on Turkmenistan

target.value: 2020:The ISLD and the Working Group members are better equipped to develop Turkmenistan

title.narrative: The UNICEF/Washington Group module on child functioning is used in national censuses and/or surveys

baseline.value: Weak (4): No data on child functioning collected in routine national surveys

target.value: 2020:Established (2): Country collects disaggregated data on child functioning and analyses it. While it is not yet routinely used by policy makers or in budgeting exercises, the use of the data is maximized in CRC state reporting and programming.

actual.value: 2019:Initiating (3). The 2019 MICS included the new UNICEF/WG module on child functioning as well as the module on adult functioning (for women). The findings and their quality will be available during the first half of 2020. Following the publication of results, there is a plan to bring all the data on
